data.title: allies01 - mission successful despite failed objectives
data.body:
Hello,

I found a bug in a single-player mission _In the thick of it_ of Red Alert. This bug might be relevant to other SP missions as well, because it's likely objective evaluation is wrong.
##### Objectives:
- Find Einstein - primary - done
- Tanya and Einstein must survive - primary - failed
- Wait for the helicopter and extract Einstein - primary - failed
- Protect all civilians - secondary - doesn't matter :)
##### How to reproduce:

Once Einstein is on his way in the helicopter, get Tanya killed. This can be achieved by either leaving soldiers around or destroying only one power plant. Once allied destroyers arrive, they start destroying base. This will result in tesla coil being operational again.

It's very important to get Einstein in that helicopter. If you kill Tanya from the get go, mission will fail as expected. It's also noteworthy to say in game voice says _Mission failed_, but the mission summary says _Mission accomplished_ despite failed primary objectives as stated above.

**Tags**: bug, RA, single-player

data.title: Fix: AttackMove moving when within range
data.body: With this a unit no longer moves a cell when issued an attack move and he is within range of an enemy.

data.title: Better Airdrop Production
data.body:
This change allows the Production class and its children to take in multiple actors to be produced.
This is needed for #7055 so that the units produced can exit in an orderly fashion.

data.title: Add OreRefineryInfo.DepositAsCash bool
data.body:
\+ `OreRefineryInfo.DepositAsCash` bool

Requested by @scskwirl over IRC.

data.title: Added multiplier traits
data.body: Removing GainsStatUpgrades, InvulnerabilityUpgrade, & Invulnerable.

data.title: Command-line arguments and some sort of "URI scheme" ?
data.body:
It's an Idea/Feature.
The short idea is to be able to join an OpenRA server from anywhere outside OpenRA, like adding a Join button in front of every game listed on http://www.openra.net/games/.
The long idea is to be able to create links like _openra://123.123.123.123:1234_ (I don't know if it really has a connection with http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URI_scheme, I never investigated it) which would be interpreted by the operating systems into something like _openra.exe -connect 123.123.123.123:1234_.

data.title: Improve radar rendering performance
data.body:
This introduces a CellEntryChanged event on CellLayer, and uses this to cut out most of the heavy looping from the radar updates.  These events will also be used by the ingame map editor, and should help significantly with our shroud rendering performance.

The old radar code split the update over 12 ticks, with only three of these doing actual work.  This is no longer necessary, which gives us a much smoother radar view.

I verified that this doesn't regress performance by timing `RadarWidget.Tick` over 1000 ticks on the biggest and smallest maps that I could find:
![histogram](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/5260885/c092c220-7a78-11e4-9abb-26d9a4f7cd72.png)

data.title: Bulk production queue

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
This adds a new production queue.

It allows the player to place an order and get them in a bulk.

Its possible to define a minimum and maximum amount of units in each order.
You can also define a static production time or use a dynamic one.

You currently cannot do multiple orders at a time but will have to wait for the current one to finish.

This needs a UI that implements the Finalize Production order since currently it just adds the units to an order as soon as it can.

P.S. The production time does not include the time it takes for the starport transport to arrive.

data.title: D2K Original Starport
data.body:
This is a TODO for changing the starport in D2K so it functions like the one in the original game.
- [ ] Implement Bulk production (deliver units in one go) (#7056)
- [ ] Make the transport stop and make units get off in an orderly fashion ~~(#7061)~~ ~~(#7468)~~  (#7786)
- [ ] Make the transport come down vertically  (#7786)
- [ ] Implement UI for Bulk transport, select units and hit "Purchase" to make the order, this depends on a new D2k UI and its a blocker for most of the other stuff being merged.

Extra:
- [ ] Fluctuating prices #2252

allows the admin to specify a delay for observers.

P.S. This delay does not apply to the admin if he is a spectator simply because that would screw up the AI completely.

data.body:
Closes #6991

You use it by typing /whisper (PlayerName) (Whatever you want to say)

data.title: Disengage observers

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
We have finally done it by using a mixture of quantum physics and black magic.

Observers have now been disengaged from the order manager.

This means that normal players will no longer lag because the connection of an observer is slow,
this also means that even if the observer lags it he can still watch the whole game.

A testcase for this is easy, just take 2 clients host a bot match with one of the clients as an observer,
pause the observer client with a debugger, resume after half a minute or so.

Enjoy watching the game from behind and talking to the players that are playing in the future.
(The Players can still see your messages even if you are 5 minutes behind and you can still see theirs)

data.title: Added missing stance check.
data.body:
Fixes #7030 

UpgradeActorsNear was missing a stance check in ActorExited method inside UpgradeActorsNear.

data.title: AI interaction with Sandworms
data.body:
With the Sandworms in the oven, the AI will have to be taught to avoid them. This will require the notifications about "WormSign" and "WormAttack" to be conveyed to the AI as well as the player and also must include general avoidance of an incoming worm.
I am putting this here so it doesn't get forgotten and because I haven't a clue how to deal with the AI.

data.title: Rename upgrades as conditions and levels
data.body:
Upgrades are really conditions (states) that can be thought of as (type, count) pairs where count is called its level.
### Preliminary renames:

Core:
- Upgrades/ => Conditions/ (directory)
- IUpgradable => IConditional
  - UpgradeTypes => ConditionTypes
  - AcceptsUpgradeLevel(...) => AcceptsConditionLevel(...)
  - UpgradeLevelChanged(...) => ConditionLevelChanged(...)
- UpgradableTrait[Info] => ConditionalTrait[Info]
  - UpgradeMinEnabledLevel => MinEnabledConditionLevel
  - UpgradeMaxEnabledLevel => MaxEnabledConditionLevel
  - UpgradeMaxAcceptedLevel => MaxAcceptedConditionLevel
  - UpgradeEnabled(...) => ConditionallyEnabled(...) or EnabledByCondition(...)
  - UpgradeDisabled(...) => ConditionallyDisabled(...) or DisabledByCondition(...)
- UpgradeManager[Info] => ConditionManager[Info]
  - TimedUpgrade => ConditionTimer[Token]  pending UpgradeToken/ConditionToken addition
  - UpgradeState => ConditionState (from the Department of Redundancy Department)
  - GrantTimedUpgrade(...) => GrantConditionTimer(...)
  - NotifyUpgradeLevelChanged(...) => NotifyConditionLevelChanged(...)
  - GrantUpgrade(...) => GrantConditionLevel(...)
  - RevokeUpgrade(...) => RevokeConditionLevel(...)
  - AcceptsUpgrade(...) => AcceptsConditionType(...)
- GlobalUpgradeManager[Info] => GlobalConditionManager[Info]
- UpgradeProperties => ConditionProperties

Traits
- DisableUpgrade[Info] => Disabled[Info]
- GrantUpgradeCrateAction[Info] => GrantConditionLevelCrateAction[Info]
  - UnitUpgradeCrateAction => UnitConditionLevelCrateAction
- GrantUpgradePower[Info] => GrantConditionLevelPower[Info]
- PassengerInfo
  - GrantUpgrades => GrantLevelToConditions
- InvulnerabilityUpgrade[Info] => InvulnerabilityCondition or Invulnerability
- GainsStatUpgrades[Info] => GainsStatLevels[Info] - to be split
  - DamageUpgrade (damage taken modifier)
  - FirepowerUpgrade => FirepowerLevel
  - ReloadUpgrade => ReloadLevel
  - SpeedUpgrade => SpeedLevel
- TimedUpgradeBar[Info] => ConditionTimerBar[Info]
- UpgradeActorsNear[Info] => ApplyConditionLevelToActorsNear[Info]
- UpgradeOverlay[Info] => ConditionalOverlay[Info] or Overlay[Info]
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/6645383-rename-upgrades-as-conditions-and-levels?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove Chronoshiftable trait from TD mod vehicles
data.body: I noticed that vehicles in the TD mod have the Chronoshiftable trait. Since I don't think that is really needed, I removed it. It should go without saying that redundant traits are bad.

data.title: Fixed vehicles can't move to nearby walled tile
data.body:
The fix for #6989 is mainly done in lines 73,74 in OpenRA.Mods.RA/Move/PathFinder.cs, rest of the patch is mainly naming convention changes. I'm aware that they might be wrong since this is my first pull request to this project.

Anyway the reason for this bug is that the first fromSrc.Expand-call doesn't add the grid position where the vehicle is located to the queue as there is no self awareness in the directional search that's moving towards the vehicle, this makes the search end early since that queue will be empty.

data.title: OpenRA.Editor.exe loads nothing
data.body:
Every time I try to load the editor nothing happens. No screen loads, no message saying it failed to run, the only thing that happens is a slight instance where the program icon flickers the same way all program icons do before a window is opened. I tried running as administrator and still the same issues happens. I then tried to test compatibility under multiple different settings and still nothing happens. It's as though the editor was just an empty icon to click on... Is there a special program I need to install? The game runs just fine. I would like to make my own maps to play with and share.

 I'm running a stock Dell with an Intel Core i5-4440 CPU @ 3.10 GHz RAM 12 GB with a 64-bit OpSys, x64-based processor running Widows 8.1

I can't begin to fathom how a program that's so seemingly antiquated could be so incompatible and yet it's counterpart could run so smoothly.

data.title: Added map editor categories to TD tilesets
data.body: As title says.

data.title: Fixed teleporter check the target instead of the initiating owner shrouds
data.body: Essentially just https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7017 with the fixes I suggested.

data.title: Starting RA menu bug.
data.body: Sometimes, when I go to the menu of RA I have the replay of Shell Map played.

data.title: Further memory usage reductions from enums
data.body:
@RoosterDragon's recent changes to enums in #6988 made me think why not change all enums to use `sbyte`. It would be more memory-efficient (even if by a little) AND consistent (now some are using `byte` and others are using the default `int`).
I don't think we have an enum with 127 elements, so there shouldn't be problems.
Also it might be good to make them all start counting from 1 instead of the default 0.
Please share your thoughts on the matter.

data.title: Brought back TAB to switch team/all chat when nothing has been typed yet
data.body: The new ALT hotkey from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6281 is driving me nuts. When you have not typed anything and therefore nothing can be auto-completed, this will allow you to still use it to switch team and public chat.
